intro: Elphegea reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed elphegea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are slender and branching. Elphegea reflexa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
